introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Welcome to QuakeSafe. These Terms of Service ('Terms') govern your use of the QuakeSafe application. By accessing or using QuakeSafe, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By using QuakeSafe, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to these Terms, please do not use the application.

service.title: Service Description
service.content: QuakeSafe is a free, open-source Progressive Web Application (PWA) that provides:
features: Real-time earthquake monitoring from multiple authoritative sources
Interactive maps showing recent seismic activity
Safety guides and emergency preparedness information
Emergency resource locators for specific regions
Offline functionality for critical safety information

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.warning: QUAKESAFE IS AN INFORMATIONAL TOOL ONLY AND SHOULD NOT BE YOUR SOLE SOURCE FOR EMERGENCY INFORMATION.
items: QuakeSafe is NOT an official emergency alert system
Data may be delayed, incomplete, or inaccurate
Always follow official emergency services and local authorities
We are not responsible for any decisions made based on information from this app
In case of emergency, contact local emergency services immediately (911, 112, etc.)
This app does not replace official earthquake early warning systems

responsibilities.title: User Responsibilities
items: Use QuakeSafe as a supplementary information tool only
Verify critical information with official sources
Follow guidance from local emergency management authorities
Maintain your own emergency preparedness plans
Ensure you have access to official emergency alert systems
Use the app responsibly and not for malicious purposes

intellectual.title: Intellectual Property
intellectual.content: QuakeSafe is open-source software. The application code is available under an open-source license. Earthquake data is provided by third-party sources (USGS, GeoNet, BMKG, PHIVOLCS) and remains the property of those organizations. Map data is provided by OpenStreetMap contributors.

thirdPartyData.title: Third-Party Data Sources
thirdPartyData.content: QuakeSafe aggregates data from multiple authoritative sources:
sources: USGS (United States Geological Survey) - Subject to USGS terms
GeoNet (New Zealand) - Subject to GeoNet terms

availability.title: Service Availability
availability.content: We strive to keep QuakeSafe available 24/7, but we do not guarantee uninterrupted access. The service may be temporarily unavailable due to maintenance, updates, or factors beyond our control. Third-party data sources may also experience outages.

modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify or discontinue QuakeSafe at any time without notice. We may also update these Terms from time to time. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.

law.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws. Any disputes arising from these Terms or your use of QuakeSafe shall be resolved in accordance with the laws of your jurisdiction.
